entry.title: Re: patch/create Account Assignment M for a existing Purc...
entry.content:
Hello @Phil_P 

Thank you for your question.

To summarise, account assignment handling in public cloud for purchase order through OData follows a two-step logic because of how the manage transactional consistency works within the clean-core framework.

You are correct that the system treats the Item-level “AccountAssignmentCategory” as an update to the item entity. The account assignment line itself as a create (POST) under the nested entity set _PurOrdAccountAssignment.

However, OData service for purchase Orders does not support performing both actions in a single payload or PATCH call. You are required to perform these operations sequentially. First you need to update the item category, then create the account assignment line.

Have a look at the following references for further details.

APIs in Sourcing and Procurement, Operations for Purchase Order, Display Purchasing Documents by Account Assignment, Account assignment in purchasing document

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: サプライヤ請求書の転記制御方法
entry.content:
Dear @Tyamada,

My recommendation below: If I understood your case incorrectly please let me know and describe in English.

  • Configure the flexible workflow for “Parked Invoice as Complete” in Manage Workflows for Supplier Invoices. The creator uses Save as Completed, which triggers approval in My Inbox.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0e602d466b99490187fcbb30d1dc897c/9bd9a6b4124446a5b31ddfecbff07508.html

 

  • Authorizations / apps (role separation)
  • Role A – Creator: grant access to Park Supplier Invoices (so they can hold/park)

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0e602d466b99490187fcbb30d1dc897c/2527430934784953a5659106578ca695.html

 

  • Role B – Approver/Poster: grant My Inbox for approvals and allow posting after approval
  • Hard safeguard (Public Cloud BadI)
    Because the Post button can bypass workflow, implement the BadI MRM_CHECK_INVOICE_CLOUD (via Custom Logic app) to block posting until the invoice is approved.

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3673139

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3496626

 

BadI logic (idea):
If Action = Post and the invoice is not yet approved / still In Approval, raise an error (for example: „Posting not allowed, in approval status”.

 

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Re: Business rule for Variable Pay and/or Rewards&Recognition that are using data from custom MD
entry.content: Tatiana, For the Var Pay question, MDF tables do not work in that manner. The Rows are read and that row is determined to be eligible or ineligible. We have for other clients used a separate VP template where we calculate the number of days in each assignment and then total the number of days at the entry level. We usually see this condition for leaves, not one off days where the employee is sick or on vacation. The situation would indicate days eligible and days on leave. This would require an assignment record for the time that is off. If seems like you may not have that data. From there you can use a custom column to calculate if a person is ineligible or eligible base on the number of days and load a TRUE/FALSE column into the MDF and thn reference that column in your eligibility rule. An alternative would be to calculate outside the system and load a TRUE/FALSE value into the MDF.

entry.title: Story report convert a date and time column to only display the date
entry.content:
Searching the list of functions https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-platform/story-reports/formula-functions-in-calculated-columns-for-sap-analytics-cloud-stories?q=todate I haven't found a way to convert a column that displays a datetime to only display a date.

I tried TODATE function (https://me.sap.com/notes/3139734/E) but its confusing some documentation says it requires a string and then another parameter. Others say if it's a datemine as the first parameter no second parameter is needed. 

for example this is the value of the Performance form - Form start date Jul 21, 2025 7:59:59 PM

When I try to use TODATE in a calculated column with the performance form start date I just get an error if I use one parameter and if I try two parameters it gives an error that it is not a string.

entry.title: How to Unassign Freight Unit (FU) from Freight Order (FO) using BOPF action in ABAP (SCMTMS/TOR)?
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am working on an ABAP development requirement within SAP Transportation Management (TM) and need to programmatically unassign a Freight Unit (FU) from a Freight Order (FO).

In an other development method DO_ACTION of class /bobf/if_tra_service_manager was used to assign to freight unit to freight order with the following code:

 

DATA: lo_srv_mgr    TYPE REF TO /bobf/if_tra_service_manager.

*-- Initialize service manager for TOR
  lo_srv_mgr = /bobf/cl_tra_serv_mgr_factory=>get_service_manager( /scmtms/if_tor_c=>sc_bo_key ).

  TRY.
      CALL METHOD lo_srv_mgr->do_action
        EXPORTING
          iv_act_key    = /scmtms/if_tor_c=>sc_action-root-add_fu_by_fuid   
          it_key        = VALUE #( ( key = <la_un>-db_key_odn ) )     "GUID FREIGHT ORDER
*         it_key        = lt_n_fo_key
          is_parameters = NEW /scmtms/s_tor_a_add_elements( string = lv_fu_str )  " FREIGHT UNI
*         is_parameters = lr_s_parameters
        IMPORTING
          eo_message    = lo_message
          et_failed_key = DATA(lt_fail).
    CATCH /bobf/cx_frw_contrct_violation.
  ENDTRY.

Now I was thinking about doing something similar, but I can't find the right action key among costants in /scmtms/if_tor_c=>sc_action .

Any suggestions?
Thanks in advance

entry.title: Re: Business rule for Variable Pay and/or Rewards&Recognition that are using data from custom MD
entry.content: For the RnR issue, You should again have a field that is a TRUE/FALSE field for eligibility. This field should be defaulted to false and have a business rule update the field when the disciplinary action field is updated. You might want to have a rule that runs regularly to update the MDF so the eligibility is updated on a regular basis.

entry.title: Re: Standard bank file format "JP_ZENGINKYO" does not out...
entry.content:
Good day @khanhlynx99 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references for further details.

Payment Medium Format, Creating Custom Payment Medium Formats, Creating Custom Payment Medium Formats, Customizing for Payments

To summarise, in public cloud, when you use or copy a standard payment medium format (such as JP_ZENGINKYO) in the Manage Payment Medium Formats app, it is common to observe that certain standard mapping sources (e.g., FPAYHX-REFxx) appear empty in your custom format even though data exists in the payment run.

The reason is because of how the standard extraction logic for the FPAYHX (Header) and FPAYP (item) structures is encapsulated in SAP’s internal class CL_PYMTM_FORMAT_JP_ZENGINKYO, which cannot be modified or enhanced in the public cloud.

When you copy the standard format, that link to the SAP internal extraction routine is not inherited, and therefore, the system does not populate the FPAYHX reference fields unless the mapping source explicitly refers to a supported structure or field populated by your custom logic.

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: why we have a gap between production order in capacit...
entry.content:
Hello @nicolasduches 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references for further details.

Capacity Scheduling Table, App Extensibility: Capacity Scheduling Table, Lean Manufacturing Planning and Control, How to Realign Schedules

To summarise, the capacity scheduling table app in public cloud, uses finite scheduling logic which is based on capacity intervals, operation duration and scheduling control parameters. When you use “Realign Schedules” à Find slot, the system does not simply compress all operations back-to-back. Instead, it performs a rescheduling simulation that respects the available capacity intervals, rounding logic and any planning fences. That is why you see gaps between production orders even when the work center is set to 24 hours available, you use single-operation production orders, and you have minimal setup or teardown times.

You can avoid this by:

  • Using Reschedule or Dispatch instead of Find Slot for continuous flow.
  • Review your capacity interval setup to ensure truly continuous 00:00-24:00 availability

 

The conclusion is, the behaviour you experienced is standard and was designed to ensure compliance with the clean-core approach in public cloud.

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Cloud-Native with ABAP Cloud – The Transactional Outbox Pattern
entry.content:
Cloud-Native with ABAP Cloud – The Transactional Outbox Pattern

Cheers ABAP folks!

In modern, distributed system landscapes, ensuring data consistency between a database and a message broker is a common challenge – especially when it comes to the integration of S/4HANA Cloud with Side-by-Side extensions built on the SAP Business Technology Platform (e.g. SAP BTP ABAP Environment, aka. Steampunk) or any other microservice-based architecture.

How do you guarantee that a database update (“Order created”) and a corresponding message (like "Request a shipping of the order") are never out of sync? The answer lies in the Transactional Outbox Pattern. This elegant solution ensures that these two critical operations are treated as a single, atomic unit, which is vital for maintaining data integrity and building robust, event-driven architectures atop SAP's core business processes.

 

The Logical Unit of Work

The Logical Unit of Work (LUW) in ABAP represents a series of database operations that are treated as a single, indivisible transaction. All changes made within an LUW, whether updates, insertions, or deletions, must either be committed to the database successfully or rolled back entirely if an error occurs, ensuring transactional consistency. This "all or nothing" principle is managed by the ABAP transaction service, typically involving database commits to finalize the changes. In standard ABAP programming, a database LUW ends when a program executes a COMMIT WORK or ROLLBACK WORK statement, or when a dialog transaction concludes. However, transactional consistency can only be ensured within the same database system. There are plenty of alternatives, when it comes to cloud-native architecture and micro service design. However, a well-established approach is to apply the paradigm of eventual consistency.

 

Eventual Consistency

Eventual consistency is a relaxed consistency model in distributed systems where updates are not instantly propagated, meaning different replicas might temporarily show conflicting data. However, given enough time and the assumption that no further updates occur, the system guarantees that all data will reach a consistent state (soon).

 

The Transactional Outbox Pattern

The transactional outbox pattern directly supports eventual consistency by decoupling the primary data write from the external message emission. It ensures the message has been reliably persisted within the same database transaction as the data change, guaranteeing that the required event will only be sent and consumed by other services, if the main transaction succeeded. Due to the defer of the message emission the micro service is much more robust against spontaneous outages.

Figure 1: Unstable microservice design. Depending on the execution sequence, the transactional data or the status reflected to the remote system might be inconsistent, if the microservice is affected by an outage in between.

Figure 2: More robust microservice design. The message is only emitted, if the transactional data and the outbox, which acts as trigger for the publisher, was successfully committed.

 

Implementing a Transactional Outbox in ABAP Cloud

In ABAP Cloud there is the background processing framework (bgPF) available, which can seamlessly be integrated in the transactional processing of an ABAP application built with the RESTful Application Programming model (RAP).

The clue: Instead of directly emitting outbound messages in the save sequence of your transaction, a handler can be registered, which is executed asynchronously in the background, once the RAP framework successfully complemented the database commit. This custom handler grants additional flexibility on top of the transactional outbox pattern, allowing the ABAP application to control how a certain message should be handled (emitted to an external system, processed internally, etc.).

Figure 3: Implementation of the "Transactional Outbox Pattern" in ABAP Cloud.

This setup involves only two components, everything else is handled by the RAP runtime out-of-the-box:

  • The definition of a bgPF handler, which implements the actual message (e.g. external system call) emission. The handler needs to implement the interface IF_BGMC_OP_SINGLE.
class zcl_rap_bgpf_request_shipping definition
  public
  final
  create private.
  public section.

    class-methods create_instance
      importing
        is_order           type zr_order000
      returning
        value(ro_instance) type ref to if_bgmc_op_single.

    interfaces if_bgmc_op_single.

  protected section.
  private section.

    methods constructor
      importing
        is_order type zr_order000.
    data ms_order type zr_order000.

endclass.
class zcl_rap_bgpf_request_shipping implementation.

  method if_bgmc_op_single~execute.
    "implement outbound call or system local processing
    modify entity zr_shippingrequest
      create
        set fields auto fill cid
          with value #(
            ( %data = value #(
              OrderReference = ms_order-uuid
              ShippingStatus = 'Ordered' )
            )
          )
   mapped data(mapped)
   failed data(failed)
   reported data(reported).
  endmethod.

  method create_instance.
    return new zcl_rap_bgpf_request_shipping( is_order ).
  endmethod.

  method constructor.
    ms_order = is_order.
  endmethod.

endclass.
​
  • The registration of the handler within the save sequence of the RAP business object.
method save_modified.
  "...
  data(lo_factory) = cl_bgmc_process_factory=>get_default( ).
  data(lo_process) = lo_factory->create( ).
  lo_process->set_name( 'Request shipping' )->set_operation(
    zcl_rap_bgpf_request_shipping=>create_instance(
      is_order = corresponding #( <ls_order> )
    )
  ).
  lo_process->save_for_execution( ).
  "...
endmethod.
​

By that, the RAP runtime ensures that the persisted order data is always in sync with the status reflected to the dependent application. If the main process is affected by an outage, the transactional data, as well as the registration for the message emission will be rolled-back. By that, the actual message will never be emitted.

 

Process Monitoring

The background processing framework (bgPF) in ABAP Cloud is technically based on bgRFC processes, which can be monitored via the Fiori app “Monitor bgRFC Queues”. The app displays scheduled, running and aborted processes and provides manual restart capabilities. Important to know: bgPF is one of multiple inbound destinations for bgRFC queues. A queue consists again out of multiple processing units – one of those is our registered handler.

Figure 4: Aborted bgPF process (simulated via assert violations) and its restart capabilities.

 

Additional Information

Check out some more details on the bgPF in general:
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/introducing-the-background-processing-framework/ba-p/13579056

Official documentation:
https://help.sap.com/docs/abap-cloud/abap-concepts/background-processing-framework

Complete example in GitHub:
https://github.com/SAP-samples/abap-platform-rap-transactional-outbox-with-bgpf

 

Stay tuned for further cloud native design patterns in ABAP Cloud!

Cheerio ABAP Folks!

entry.title: Re: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud: Disassembly Production Order
entry.content:
Good day @FKai 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references for further details.

https://help.sap.com/doc/b870b6ebcd2e4b5890f16f4b06827064/2020.000/en-US/WN_OP2020_EN.pdf

SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition for Process Manufacturing (Last Content Update 11/2024)

Manufacturing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition 2302

To summarise, in public cloud, there is no separate Disassembly order type delivered as standard but you can achieve the functionality by using a Production Order with a reverse BOM. This is done through the Disassembly functionality in Production Orders. It uses the same order processing apps and logic as a normal make-to-stock production but with reversed material flows.

If your process requires separate monitoring or analytics, you can copy the standard production order type and rename it for disassembly tracking.

 

Here are further information that are of good guidance.

Make-to-Stock Production - Discrete Manufacturing (BJ5)

Process Navigator - SAP for Me

Make-to-Order Production - Finished Goods Sales and Final Assembly (BJE)

Process Navigator - SAP for Me

Rework Processing - Stock-Manufactured Material (BJN)

Process Navigator - SAP for Me

Rework Processing - Work-in-Process (BJQ)

Process Navigator - SAP for Me

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Stop emailing alerts to AIF recipients
entry.content:
I think the only solution is a user-specific one. Each and every user under the recipient list needs to individually disable the alert emails from the interface monitor /AIF/IFMON.

This yellow marked button above acts as a toggle. Every time you click on it, the icon changes to one of the following:

Icon

Description

 

Never receive an email for this interface

 

 

Receive an email for the next alert

 

Receive an email for every error for this interface, regardless of alert status

Keep clicking on the icon till you get the icon for ‘No Email’, which is .

If a recipient does this, only that person will stop receiving emails. Rest will continue to receive. So, every individual under recipient list has to do this themselves.

entry.title: Re: Cannot access F1273 as well as F6748(CBC)
entry.content:
Hi @naoakisaruyama ,

Let me suggest the following approach to isolate the problem.

After taking a note on what roles both Users A and B have, take all of their roles away except role "SAP_BR_AR_ACCOUNTANT_CL" which controls "Define Financial Statement Versions in Global Hierarchies" app. 

Then you compare the behavior of these two users.

When this is clear, you can work the same on "Automatic Account Determination (F1273)" app.

After you figure out what went wrong, then you can reassign those roles back to the users.

Please share your experience here so that we can all help and learn from your experience. 

Regards,

George

entry.title: How to Reduce Prompt Token Costs Using Toon
entry.content:
As you already might know prompt tokens are the backbone of communication with large language models (LLMs). However, as usage scales, token costs can quickly become a significant expense. If you’re using Toon—a tool designed for optimizing prompt workflows—you can dramatically cut down on these costs without sacrificing performance.

Why Token Costs Matter

Every interaction with an LLM consumes tokens. These tokens represent:

  • Input tokens: The text you send to the model.
  • Output tokens: The text generated by the model.

The more tokens you use, the higher your bill. For businesses running thousands of prompts daily, even small inefficiencies can lead to big costs.

Example:

  • Original prompt: “Please summarize the following text in a clear and concise manner, highlighting the key points and provide a RACI Matrix for S/4 HANA”
  • Compressed prompt: “Summarize key points.”

What is TOON?

TOON is a compact, human-readable serialization format designed for passing structured data to LLMs with significantly reduced token usage. It acts as a lossless, drop-in representation of JSON, optimized for token efficiency.

Why Use TOON?

  • Token-efficient: Saves 30–60% tokens compared to formatted JSON for large uniform arrays.
  • LLM-friendly: Explicit lengths and fields improve parsing and validation.
  • Minimal syntax: Removes redundant punctuation (braces, quotes).
  • Tabular arrays: Declare keys once, stream data as rows.
  • Optional key folding: Collapses nested chains into dotted paths for fewer tokens.

Benchmarks

  • TOON uses 39.6% fewer tokens than JSON while improving retrieval accuracy (73.9% vs 69.7%).
  • For uniform tabular data, TOON is slightly larger than CSV (+6%) but far smaller than JSON (-58%).

When NOT to Use TOON

  • Deeply nested or non-uniform structures → JSON may be better.
  • Pure tabular data → CSV is smaller.
  • Latency-critical apps → Benchmark first; compact JSON might be faster.

How to Use TOON

NPM Lib
npm install @Toon-format/toon

Python
https://github.com/xaviviro/python-toon

 https://github.com/toon-format/toon 

https://github.com/toon-format/spec 

Why TOON Matters while your working for different SAP Product LoBs

  1. Token Cost Reduction

    • SAP S/4 HANA systems handle large datasets (e.g., thousands of line items in a purchase order).
    • JSON representation of these datasets is expensive in token terms.
    • TOON compresses this data by 30–60%, reducing LLM API costs significantly.

  2. Performance Gains

    • Smaller prompts mean lower latency and faster response times.
    • This is critical for real-time SAP applications like Joule for procurement or HR assistants.

  3. Improved Accuracy

    • TOON’s explicit structure (e.g., tabular arrays with declared keys) helps LLMs parse data better.
    • This reduces hallucinations in SAP workflows like financial reconciliation or compliance checks.

High Level Flow

Integration Approach

  • Middleware Layer: Convert SAP OData/JSON responses to TOON before sending to LLM.
  • SAP BTP Extension: Implement TOON conversion in Cloud Foundry apps or Kyma runtime or SAP Databricks, AI Core Models you have selected.
  • Prompt Wrapping: Always wrap TOON in fenced code blocks for LLM clarity

Best Practices

  • Use tab-delimited rows for extra token savings.
  • Benchmark TOON vs JSON for your specific SAP dataset.
  • Cache static context to avoid repeated token costs.

Conclusion

TOON offers a simple yet powerful way to reduce LLM costs in your SAP landscape environments. By compressing structured data without losing meaning, SAP teams can achieve:

  • Up to 60% cost savings
  • Faster response times
  • Improved AI accuracy

As SAP continues its AI journey, adopting TOON can make intelligent automation more scalable and cost-effective.

entry.title: Re: Fiori app equivalent to transaction MRN3 in S/4HANA P...
entry.content:
Hi byd,

I was not able to find that the equivalent functionality exists in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

I compared the relevant help articles:

Lowest Value Determination Help (S/4HANA): 

"The system provides various procedures for lowest value determination:

Lowest Value Determination Based On Market Prices

Lowest Value Determination Based On Range of Coverage

Lowest Value Determination Based On Movement Rate

Lowest Value Determination: Loss-Free Valuation"

Lowest Value Determination Help (S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition):

"The functionality for lowest value determination enables you to find the lowest value based on:

  • Market prices

  • Range of coverage

  • Movement rate"

The relevant Best Practice for this functionality is BEJ (Inventory Valuation for Year-End Closing (BEJ_US)).

I compared the test scripts for the Private Edition vs the Public Edition for BEJ.

The Public Edition version of BEJ omits the Loss-Free Valuation:

Finally, I checked with Joule for Consultants and here was the final response summary:

"Note: Based on the available information, there is no direct Fiori app equivalent for transaction MRN3 in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition."

I would recommend to create an Influence Request on the SAP Influence Portal

I hope this helps

Thank you

Jerry

entry.title: Re: SAP Cloud Platform Enterprise Messaging as an eventbus for SuccessFactors
entry.content:
Has anyone successfully connected SAP Event Mesh (EMIS) with SuccessFactors using Intelligent Service Center?

I've encountered an issue with URL encoding of the topic/queue component in the REST messaging protocol endpoint URL, which occurs in both Integration Center (Custom Integration) and Event Connector. The proper URL construction for REST endpoints is documented here: https://help.sap.com/docs/event-mesh/event-mesh/use-rest-apis-to-send-and-receive-messages

Here's what I'm experiencing:

  • Event Connector: The URL is decoded prematurely during editing of the endpoint URL field
  • Integration Center: The URL is decoded at runtime, which is visible in the error logs

Both approaches fail with a 404 error (URL not found). This behavior is consistent with what happens when sending a non-URL-encoded queue/topic component via Bruno/Postman—also resulting in a 404 error.

This problem is referenced in SAP's knowledge base, but no solution has been provided: https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3120396

best regards,

Mateusz

entry.title: Second Half 2025: What’s New in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central?
entry.content:
The Second Half 2025 Release delivers many exciting innovations within SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central. We are introducing new features and capabilities designed to enhance experiences and boost efficiency for all users. Here is a snapshot of what you can expect to see in this release:

New People Profile
We are excited to announce that we have completed the refresh of the People Profile view experience, incorporating valuable customer input and feedback. In addition, customers can now leverage optimized experiences for updating employee information and navigating historical changes. New full-page views enable users to quickly insert, edit, or delete records, further simplifying employee data management. Learn more about the new People Profile experience here.

New edit and history experiences in the People Profile

 

Mass changes to job relationships
We are further expanding the capabilities of the mass data management tool to support updates to job relationships. Admins can leverage a simplified UI to quickly initiate changes for multiple employees without the need for technical expertise.

Mass changes to job relationships

 

Enhanced alerts
We have enhanced SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central alerts (emails and home page to-dos) with the ability to include additional employee-specific information, such as work permit type, document number, and exact expiry date. This added context provides users with a clearer understanding of task urgency and supports more informed decisions.

Configurable org chart cards
Customers can now tailor the information shown on org chart cards to their specific needs by choosing which employee detail to display, such as location, department, or a custom field. This enables a more customized org chart experience that is aligned to organizational requirements.

Org chart card configuration

 

Workforce composition and compensation insights
As part of the initial release of People Intelligence in SAP Business Data Cloud, we are delivering ready-to-run intelligent apps for workforce composition and compensation. Powered by data from SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central, customers can leverage actionable AI-driven workforce insights to drive informed people and business decisions.

Workforce composition insights

 

Learn more
These are just a few of the many innovations in the SAP SuccessFactors Second Half 2025 Release. To learn more, check out the resources below:

  • Visit the SAP SuccessFactors Product Release & Road Map Information page for release documentation, product videos, and solution area blogs
  • Watch the 2H 2025 Release Highlights Overview Video, featuring Bianka Woelke, GVP Head of Application Product Management
  • Discover all innovations in the What's New Viewer

entry.title: Let’s Talk About UI5: Your Questions Will Steer Our December UI5ers Live Session
entry.content:
This December, we’re flipping the script for our final UI5ers live session of the year. Instead of us presenting, we want you to set the agenda. Join us on Thursday, 4th December, at 15:15 CET, for a special “Ask Us Anything” session where Stefan Beck, Andreas Kunz, Peter Muessig, and Margot Wollny will be ready to tackle your questions on UI5’s future, architecture, and more.

This is more than just a Q&A; it’s a conversation. Your questions, your feedback, and your perspective are what help guide the evolution of UI5. We genuinely want to know what’s on your mind, what challenges you, and what you’re excited about.

Help Us Shape the Conversation

To make this session as insightful as possible, we invite you to send us your questions in advance. We’re especially looking for questions that spark discussion around broader topics. To get you thinking, here are a few examples of the kinds of questions we’d love to explore:

  • 🗺️ The Future & Roadmap:
    • “What are the long-term plans for Web Components in UI5 applications?”
    • “Are there still plans for an open-source tool for theming?”
  • 🏗️ Architecture & Design Decisions:
    • “Why does the architecture of the OData V4 model differ so much from the one for the OData V2 model?”
    • "Could you explain the trade-offs considered when designing the current routing system?”
  • 👍👎Constructive Feedback (The Good and The Bad):“
    • "I find the data binding syntax incredibly powerful. Are there plans to expand on this?”
    • “Managing dependencies across multiple libraries can feel complex. Have you considered ways to simplify this?”

Why Send Your Questions in Advance?

While we will absolutely take questions live, submitting them beforehand helps us make the session better for everyone. It allows our team to:

  • Prepare thoughtful, in-depth answers instead of just off-the-cuff replies.
  • Spot common themes and group related questions to address a topic more comprehensively.
  • Bring in the right expert from the team if a question requires specific knowledge.
  • Prepare a quick code sample or visual aid if it helps clarify a complex concept.

Your early submissions will directly contribute to a more valuable and well-prepared discussion.

Ready to Ask? Here’s How:

To ensure our team has time to review everything, please send your questions by Monday, 1st December 2025. You have a few options:

  • Comments below: Simply add your question as a comment on this article
  • Email: If you prefer, send your question to us at openui5@sap.com

We are truly looking forward to this open dialogue and hearing directly from you. Let’s make this a fantastic final session of the year, together.

entry.title: Re: Unified Destination Setup for Accessing Multiple ODat...
entry.content:
Good day @sawa-tomoki 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references for further details.

Configure Communication Management, Configure Communication Arrangements, Extending Existing SAP Solutions Using SAP BTP    , Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

To summarise, external access to OData APIs is managed in public cloud strictly through communication scenarios and communication arrangements. Each of which:

  • Represents a defined set of released APIs grouped by business area,
  • Is secured by its own technical communication user and OAuth token endpoint, and
  • Is governed by clean-core principle, which ensures APIs are only exposed in the scope defined by managed communication scenarios.

Each time you create a communication arrangement (e.g., SAP_COM_0109 for Sales Orders, SAP_COM_0008 for Purchase Orders, etc.), SAP Cloud Identity and the communication management layer generate:  a unique Service Key/URL endpoint and a dedicated OAuth client in your S4H tenant. Because of this architectural isolation, each destination in BTP maps to one communication arrangement and therefore one API set.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Business rule for Variable Pay and/or Rewards&Recogni...
entry.content:
Hi @tatiana_caraima 

There are no issues in integrating Comp and VarPay with Time Off as long as you do the following: 

https://community.sap.com/t5/human-capital-management-blog-posts-by-sap/time-off-integration-in-compensation-eligibility-rules/ba-p/13579851

 

Aligned with David on using a VarPay template for the rest and not an effective dated MDF because of the following known hurdles (which I have mentionned on other threads on the community chat before, especially the one with inactive users) :

 

  • The first one is that MDFs do not behave like another JobInfo or CompInfo when mapped to the comp module rules. They need a record in them effective 1/1/1900 (or at the latest effective on the day of the record that's active in EC entering the Varpay program start date) before the actual record loaded by the customer to return expected results when applied. 
    • For example if the VarPay template has a program start date of 1/1/2025 and you load only one MDF record effective 5/1/2025 expecting the varpay record retrieved for this employee to show only from 5/1/2025 to 12/31/2025, it will not work. You would need the MDF to have a first record of 1/1/1900 or at the latest as of the start date of the Job Info record which is effective on varpay program start date of 1/1/2025 (for example : 10/1/2024 - position title change).
    • An easy workaround for this limitation is to use Integration Center with a nightly job that would add a record with start-date= Hire date for each employee.

 

  • The second one is that MDFs mapped to Comp/Varpay eligibility rules will not work for Inactive employees. 
    • For example you've got someone who was eligible on 1/1/2025, then had a data change on 4/1/2025 to make them ineligible that was loaded into the effective dated MDF object (with above setup), then finally on 6/1/2025 the employee retired. When customer CompAdmin imports employee history from EC in the first quarter of 2026 this employee is now Retired (= INACTIVE in UDF) and as a consequence the system won't trim the varpay employee history to only retrieve 1/1/2025 to 3/31/2025, it will still retrieve 1/1/2025 to 5/31/2025 which is not the expected result. That's because MDFs don't process currently inactive employees in business rules the way the Comp module is built to process them.

 

For these reasons I try to only use effective-dated MDF objects to retrieve data in worksheets or to publish data back and NOT for eligibility purposes. For complex eligibility topics I always push to have custom fields with on Save business rules built in EC directly (for example in the Time Off integration case explaned above) instead of using effective-dated MDFs.

 

Best, 
Xavier

One of them shows the correct posting amount, but the other appears with zero amounts in both Debit (DB) and Credit (AB).

Could anyone clarify why this duplication occurs, or whether it is standard system behavior?

Thanks a lot in advance for your help!

This situation highlights an opportunity for process improvement to ensure transparency and consistency in future exam and content updates.

Definitely needs an Improvement Idea!

entry.title: Automating Data Validation in SAP ABAP: Comparing CSV Prices with Sales Order Table
entry.content:
Compare CSV Prices with SAP Sales Orders (VBAK) in ABAP 

SITUATION 

          During a data migration and sales audit project, the business team provided a CSV file containing a list of price values (net amounts). 
They wanted to verify whether all these prices existed in SAP Sales Orders (VBAK table) before approving the upload. 

Manually comparing thousands of prices between the CSV and SAP was time-consuming, error-prone, and repetitive. 

So, I decided to build a small ABAP utility to automate the comparison process between the uploaded CSV data and the SAP table VBAK-NETWR. 

TASK 

Develop an ABAP program that: 

  1. Uploads a CSV file containing a list of prices. 
  2. Validates and cleans the data (removing extra characters, symbols, etc.). 
  3. Compare those values with VBAK-NETWR (Sales Order Net Value). 
  4. Highlights of which prices don’t exist in SAP. 

In short — a quick data validation tool to assist business users before migration or audit. 

ACTION  

I developed the ABAP report with the following major steps: 

File Selection 

I added a parameter to select the CSV file using F4_FILENAME: 

This gives a simple “browse file” popup. 

File Upload Using GUI_UPLOAD 

Once selected, the CSV file is uploaded into an internal table: 

Data Validation and Cleaning 

I ensured uploaded data was numeric and properly formatted: 

Then, invalid or alphabetic entries triggered an error message: 

Conversion and Rounding 

Each value was converted into a packed number (decimal 2 places): 

Comparison with SAP Table (VBAK) 

I fetched NETWR values from VBAK for all uploaded prices: 

Then compared using binary search: 

Result Display 

If all values exist, 

Otherwise, missing prices are displayed neatly using. 

TABLES: vbak.

TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_log_a,
         price_str(50) TYPE c,
       END OF ty_log_a,

       BEGIN OF ty_log,
         price  TYPE vbak-netwr,
         status TYPE string,
       END OF ty_log.

DATA: it_log       TYPE TABLE OF ty_log_a,
      lt_final_log TYPE TABLE OF ty_log,
      ls_final_log TYPE ty_log,
      lv_file      TYPE string,
      lv_temp_prc  TYPE vbak-netwr,
      lv_invalid   TYPE abap_bool VALUE abap_false.

PARAMETERS: p_file TYPE rlgrap-filename OBLIGATORY.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* F4 Help for File Selection
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
AT SELECTION-SCREEN ON VALUE-REQUEST FOR p_file.
  CALL FUNCTION 'F4_FILENAME'
    EXPORTING
      field_name = 'P_FILE'
    IMPORTING
      file_name  = p_file.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Start of Selection
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
START-OF-SELECTION.

  MOVE p_file TO lv_file.

  IF lv_file IS INITIAL.
    MESSAGE 'Please select a CSV file to upload.' TYPE 'E'.
  ENDIF.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Upload CSV File
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
  CALL FUNCTION 'GUI_UPLOAD'
    EXPORTING
      filename = lv_file
      filetype = 'ASC'
    TABLES
      data_tab = it_log
    EXCEPTIONS
      OTHERS = 5.

  IF sy-subrc <> 0 OR it_log IS INITIAL.
    MESSAGE 'Error uploading CSV file or file is empty.' TYPE 'E'.
  ENDIF.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Validate and Convert each row
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
DATA lv_temp_price TYPE p LENGTH 15 DECIMALS 2.
DATA lv_temp_str   TYPE string.

LOOP AT it_log INTO DATA(ls_upload).

  lv_temp_str = ls_upload-price_str.
  CONDENSE lv_temp_str NO-GAPS.

  " Replace common formatting symbols
  REPLACE ALL OCCURRENCES OF '.' IN lv_temp_str WITH ''.
  REPLACE ALL OCCURRENCES OF ',' IN lv_temp_str WITH '.'.

  " Check if string is numeric (with decimal allowed)
  IF lv_temp_str CS 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ'
     OR lv_temp_str CS 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'
     OR lv_temp_str CS '!@#$%^&*()_+=<>?/;:''"[]{}|\'.
    lv_invalid = abap_true.
    EXIT.
  ENDIF.

  TRY.
      lv_temp_price = lv_temp_str.
      lv_temp_price = ROUND( val = lv_temp_price dec = 2 ).
    CATCH cx_sy_conversion_no_number.
      lv_invalid = abap_true.
      EXIT.
  ENDTRY.

  IF lv_temp_price LT 0.
    lv_invalid = abap_true.
    EXIT.
  ENDIF.

  ls_final_log-price = lv_temp_price.
  APPEND ls_final_log TO lt_final_log.

ENDLOOP.

IF lv_invalid = abap_true.
  MESSAGE 'Invalid file format: contains non-numeric or incorrect values.' TYPE 'E'.
  EXIT.
ENDIF.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Fetch NETWR from VBAK (match uploaded prices)
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
SELECT netwr
  FROM vbak
  INTO TABLE @DATA(lt_vbak)
  FOR ALL ENTRIES IN @LT_final_log
  WHERE netwr = @LT_final_log-price.

SORT lt_vbak BY netwr.
SORT lt_final_log BY price.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Compare uploaded values with VBAK
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
DATA lt_not_exist TYPE TABLE OF ty_log.

LOOP AT lt_final_log INTO DATA(ls_log).
  lv_temp_prc = ls_log-price.
  READ TABLE lt_vbak INTO DATA(ls_vbak)
       WITH KEY netwr = lv_temp_prc
       BINARY SEARCH.

  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    ls_log-status = 'Does not exist in VBAK (NETWR)'.
    APPEND ls_log TO lt_not_exist.
  ENDIF.
ENDLOOP.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Display result
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
IF lt_not_exist IS INITIAL.
  WRITE: / 'All uploaded NETWR values exist in VBAK.'.
ELSE.
  cl_demo_output=>display( EXPORTING data = lt_not_exist ).
ENDIF.

RESULT 

  • The program automated what previously took hours of manual validation. 
  • Business users can now upload any CSV and get an instant comparison result. 
    Data accuracy improved significantly during the migration audit. 
    The utility is reusable for any numeric field validation across SAP tables. 

Conclusion 

This utility bridges the gap between external data and SAP validation. 
It’s fast, accurate, and ensures data consistency across systems. 

🔥 A simple, powerful ABAP report that proves — automation is better than manual checking!

entry.title: Re: 📢 Survey: ABAP Naming Conventions
entry.content:
This is a very interesting topic and something I am currently working on. I’ve developed a Fiori App that functions as a naming convention generator, users input mandatory or optional fields, and the app produces the appropriate naming convention for a given object.

In the current design, the JavaScript backend relies heavily on hardcoded static values, which isn’t ideal. It would be much better to maintain a rules table or a dedicated app for managing these rules, as updating hardcoded values manually is both time-consuming and inefficient.

Some time ago, I also submitted an improvement request to SAP titled “Precheck Naming Convention for ABAP/FIORI Development Artifacts During Creation.” The idea suggests that SAP could introduce a BADI, allowing customers to define their own rules for creating technical objects ensuring that developers can only create objects that follow predefined naming standards. Unfortunately, despite receiving strong community support, it’s still waiting in the queue. If you could help push this forward from your end, it would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: Re: Assigning account keys to condition types in SAP Publ...
entry.content:
Hello @Mers 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references for further details.

Revenue Account Determination, Integration with Sales and Distribution (SD)

In public cloud the configuration through VKOA or SPRO is not available directly. There has been a shift to using Business Configuration (SSCUI) process which you can access through the Manage Your Solution Acitivities app.

In short: you should, define Account Keys,  Assign G/L Accounts (SSCUI100297), use pricing procedure linkage (SSCUI 102345) and maintain assignment groups in your master data.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: CCO - Issue with “Fetching Sales Order”
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We are using Customer Checkout (CCO) 2.0 FP20 integrated with SAP Business One HANA version 10.

We are facing an issue with the “Fetching Sales Order” function in CCO. When clicking this option, the system sometimes retrieves the list of sales orders from SAP Business One successfully, but most of the time it fails.
The following behavior is observed:

  • Occasionally, it works correctly and displays the sales orders.

  • At times, the system shows an “Unreachable” error message.

  • In other cases, there is no response at all.

All master data mappings (Customer, Sales Employee, Owner, etc.) have been verified and appear to be correct. However, the issue persists intermittently.

Kindly guide us on:

  1. How this scenario technically works between CCO and SAP Business One.

  2. Any basic configuration or connectivity checks we should perform to resolve the issue.

Thank you for your support.

Regards,

Rajan
